result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany L. Suchon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brittany L. Suchon
Current: 3311 Patti Drive, #7, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 08-21-2017)
Prior: 137 Tommys Turnpike, Stevens Point, WI 54481

(This case was closed prior and was brought to Court when the other files were sentenced).  ***Corrected Minutes***
Defendant Brittany L Suchon in court with attorney Sean Drury. Defendant Brittany L Suchon in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report.  
ADA states the sentencing recommendations:
13CF81 ct 1:  W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation:   
Conditions AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.   Must sign release form for all treatment providers.  Sign all releases of information for all doctors and other treatment providers and pharmacy.   Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately. Obtain and maintain employment.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent. Restitution: $535.00 Joint/several with co-defendant Luke Wojtalewicz.  Not to be on the premises of Bootlegger Bar and not to work at a tavern.    Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge. Pay costs.  No contact with Luke Wojtalewicz. 
13CF81 ct 2: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Pay costs.
13CF199 Ct 2: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Letter of apology to victim Hollie Worzalla and no contact or at residence of same victim. Pay costs.
13CM106 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Letter of apology to victim Maclovia Ysquierdo. Restitution $2,160.00.
14CF47 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Letter of apology to victim. Pay costs.
14CF47 Ct 5: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Pay costs.

Atty Drury concurs with sentencing recommendation and request any bonds posted be applied.  Jail credit still needs to be calculated yet and requests more time.
Defendant makes apologetic statements to the Court.

BTC:***********************PROBATION*******************

13CF81 ct 1:  W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation:   
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   
Not to be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business (except within scope of your employment, and/or if Agent approves).
	Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs and **controlled substance and that you are not to take any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only as prescribed. *Sign releases for your providers so that the probation agent can monitor your compliance with the treatment program, and that you provide releases to your agent so that your agent can make sure that you are only using one pharmacy for your medications. Participate in any other counseling ***as recommended by the Agent, or any other assessments that your agent reasonably requests. No contact with **Bootleggers, Angel Stubinski, Hallie Worzalla, and Maclovia Ysquierdo unless they consent and Agent approves. No contact with Luke Wojtalewicz. Submit DNA sample *** and pay the surcharge. No additional jail time. **Letters of apology to all victims including her mother and her sister.	
	Obtain and maintain full-time employment, if you are able. 	
	Pay costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.	
	Pay restitution Joint/several with co-defendant Luke Wojtalewicz.	

Restitution: $535.00 to Angel Stubinski: Joint/several with co-defendant Luke Wojtalewicz.
40 hrs Community Service.
No additional jail time.

13CF81 ct 2: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with Count 1. Same conditions. Pay costs w/DNA surcharge.

13CF199 Ct 2: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 13CF81. Same conditions and Letter of apology to victim Hallie Worzalla and no contact or at residence of same victim. Pay costs w/DNA surcharge.
13CM106 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Letter of apology to victim Maclovia Ysquierdo. Restitution $2,160.00. Pay costs w/DNA surcharge.
14CF47 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, concurrent. Same conditions. Pay costs w/DNA surcharge.
14CF47 Ct 5: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation, concurrent to all other probation sentences. Same conditions. Pay costs w/DNA surcharge.

Court will allow 30 days to determine the jail credit.
Parties will keep there respective copies of the PSI.
Bond to be applied to restitution.
Sentencing hearing on August 5, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany L. Suchon in court with attorney Sean P Drury. Defendant Brittany L. Suchon in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CF-81, 13CF-199, 13CM-106, 14CF-46 and 14CF-47.

8:39 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances and addresses the cases.

Defendant has previously entered pleas in:  13CF-81 Ct 1 and Ct 2, 13CF-199 Ct 1, and 13CM-106 Ct 1.

Now we are dealing with 14CF-46 and 14CF-47.
Defendant will be pleading to 14CF-47 Count 1 and Count 5. Remaining counts dismissed and read in.
State also moves to dismiss and read in 14CF-46.

Parties have a joint recommendation to the Court for sentencing, neither party is looking for a PSI.

State addresses the recommendation on these cases:
13CF-81:  Ct 1: withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, aoda and comply, abs sob to alco/substances, obt/mtn empt, other counseling, restitution $535, joint and several, n/c with co defendant L.W. n/c with Bootleggers Bar unless approved by agent, court costs, DNA sample and pay surcharge, Ct 2: 24 mo probation, concurrent, same conditions
13CF-199: Ct 2: withheld sentence, 24 mo prob, concurrent, same conditions, n/c with H. W. or residence occupied by her, ltr of apology to H.W., pay costs
13CM-106: Ct 1: withheld sent, 24 mo prob, concurrent, same conditions, restitution $2,160, n/c M. Y. or any residence occupied by her, ltr of apology
14CF-47: withheld sentence on both, 36 mo prob, concurrent, same conditions, addresses jail sentence

Atty Drury concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court is inclined to require a PSI.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 14CF-47 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-47 Count 5

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. 
Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drury for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-47 Count 1 Felony Identity Theft
14CF-47 Count 5 Felony Bailjumping
14CF-47 Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, Count 6 and Count 7 are dismissed and read in
14CF-46 Dismissed and Read in

Court will order a PSI and require the investigation be provided to the parties at least one week before the sentencing.
Counsel to set sentencing date with Judicial Assistant.

Remaining matters will be set for sentencing, same time as the 14CF-47 case.

Atty Knaapen addresses bond.
Atty Drury replies.

BY THE COURT:
Bonds are revoked pending sentencing.
Plea hearing on May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Matters continue to arraignment.
Atty Drury has received copies of the information and waives the reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters NOT GUILTY pleas to both cases.

Court accepts the pleas.

Bond is ordered continued.

13CF-81, 13CF-199, 13CM-106 should all track with the pretrial conference.

Defendant Brittany L. Suchon in court with attorney Sean Drury. Defendant Brittany L. Suchon in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-46 and 14CF-47.

3:33 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant will be waiving her preliminary exam in both cases.
Atty Drury concurs.  

Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files the Information.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Follow all conditions of bond in other files, including 13CF-81, 13CF-199 and 13CM-106

Defendant Brittany L Suchon in court with attorney Sean Drury. Defendant Brittany L Suchon in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are: 13CF-81, 13CF-199, 13CM-106, 14CF-46 and 14CF-47.

9:08 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, there was a plea agreement for 3 of the files. Defendant failed to appear for a sentencing hearing. In the interim, State filed two new cases.
State requests to do initial appearances on the two new cases and then proceed from there.

Atty Drury addresses the Court, requests initial appearances and schedule further.

14CF-46 and 14CF-47
Initial Appearance:
Atty Drury did receive a copy of the complaint, waives the reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Court will set these for a preliminary hearing on February 17, 2014 at 3:00 pm Branch 1

State addresses bond. 
State requests an additional $500 cash bond on each file. Comply with bond conditions on all other cases. No contact with M.S. unless consent in writing.

Other cases will be set for a status on that date/time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
